It's not a bug in the checkpointing, but it is the dynamic scoping in Python:
During the backward,

 def fwd_unit_segment(inp_):
          return torch.mv(weight_param, inp_)

and that will grab the current(!) (i.e. last processed) weight_param.
If you change that to

        def fwd_unit_segment(inp_, weight_param=weight_param):
          return torch.mv(weight_param, inp_)

(the not so pretty way of binding the weight_param at evaluation time), you get what you expect.

Please accept my apologies for not noticing earlier.
body:
It's not a bug in the checkpointing, but it is the dynamic scoping in Python:
During the backward,
```
 def fwd_unit_segment(inp_):
          return torch.mv(weight_param, inp_)
```
and that will grab the current(!) (i.e. last processed) weight_param.
If you change that to
```
        def fwd_unit_segment(inp_, weight_param=weight_param):
          return torch.mv(weight_param, inp_)
```
(the not so pretty way of binding the weight_param at evaluation time), you get what you expect.

Please accept my apologies for not noticing earlier.
